Create or join a multiplayer game.

Delete the current game and return to the main menu.

By clicking the "I Agree" button, I agree that I am about to play a "work in progress" Early Access Beta version of the Dungeon of the Endless video game. I understand that this Beta Version is incomplete and will be replaced by a complete version when the final game is released.
The final content and features of the game (available at the release) will be discussed with the community via the GAMES2GETHER platform.
The "work in progress" sections are signaled by a special icon \7804\.
Shows if this hero is 1) Unknown, 2) Discovered, or 3) Unlocked
A hero will be randomly chosen from the heroes you already have unlocked.
This hero is unknown. To start to unlock them, you must have a first random encounter with him/her/it.
$Name has been discovered but is still locked. To unlock this hero, you have to reach the final exit or survive 3 floors in a row during your next encounter while playing with them.
$Name has been unlocked. You can now send this hero to a gruesome death whenever you want.

This Hero is temporarily available during Endless Day. You must reach the final exit or survive 3 floors in a row with them before the end of the Endless Day in order to unlock and use them after this period.

The offline persistency is subject to change during the Steam Early Access period. You may lose your progression (hero and ship unlocks, game stats) several times during development and up until the release of the game.
Not yet available in this version of the game.
Click here or press Enter to start talking

Play to Win!
Thank you for participating to the Free Weekend Community Event! The more people play "Dungeon of the Endless" and "Endless Legend" during the Steam Free Weekend, the more chances they have of unlocking free upcoming content for both games. For more details on the event and unlocks, click on the "More Info" button.
No destructible modules in this room.
No controller detected. Do you wish to revert to the "Mouse & Keyboard" setting?
Items lost when leaving a floor
Items shared between players and lost each floor
Items saved for the next floor
Click to display the list of your major modules.
Click to display the list of your support minor modules.
Click to display the list of your offensive minor modules.
Click to display the list of your hindering minor modules.
Click to select the modules you want to destroy.
You cannot pause the game with this spaceship.
You cannot pause the game in multiplayer.
The next level is a special stage, it contains no major slot. Do you have enough resources to survive?
Congratulations for finishing the Early Access Beta version of Dungeon of the Endless! ($version)

This is just the beginning, as we will be regularly updating the game with awesome new content until its release. To make the game the best it can be, please take some time to give us your feedback on our GAMES2GETHER platform!
Inventory. Contains the items you have picked up which are not equipped by a hero. You lose all inventory items when you travel between dungeon floors.
This room is powered by a mysterious force.
The "Public" folder of Dungeon of the Endless has been modified. Achievements will not be recorded during this session.
You can reset your abilities cooldown with Science \7703\. The cost is proportional to the recovery time remaining.

#D0B499#Note from sales brochure: ''The pod is guaranteed to survive any crash; we hope its occupants do as well.'' #REVERT#
- No particular gameplay bonuses or penalties.

To unlock this spaceship, you need to fulfill one of these achievements:
- Win a game with the Escape Pod. - Spend 1000 Food \7700\ healing heroes in one game.

#D0B499#Note from sales brochure: ''Dedicated to your pharmaceutical well-being.'' #REVERT#
- Heroes have many more Health Points. - Cost of healing reduced. - No auto-heal at end of turn. - Most in-game items are replaced with drugs that provide buffs with some side effects. - Health Regen bonuses from passive skills are replaced by Defense \7811\ bonuses.

To unlock this spaceship, you need to fulfill one of these achievements:
- Win a game with the Armory. - Open every door in every floor in a winning game.

#D0B499#Note from sales brochure: ''Maybe you had a life before. Now, you have a dungeon!'' #REVERT#
- No Food, Industry or Science modules at start. - Endless mode: Unwinnable game!

To unlock this spaceship, you need to fulfill one of these achievements:
- Win a game with the Infirmary Pod. - Never have a hero killed in a winning game.

#D0B499#Note from sales brochure: ''Whether you're liberating, policing, enforcing, or just having fun, the Armory Pod is what you need to impose your brand of freedom.'' #REVERT#
- 4 powerful heroes at start. - Some weapons supplied at start. - No additional heroes in dungeon. - No modules except Food at start. - No offensive or Industry modules can be researched.

#F2C01C#Special content available!#REVERT# To unlock this spaceship, you need to fulfill this achievement:
- Never have the crystal lose HP in a winning game.

#D0B499#Note from sales brochure: ''Guaranteed to freeze food, people, or lava in 30 seconds or less. Caution: Do not lick.'' #REVERT#
- One faster and stronger hero for entire game. - Quick heal with Food not possible. - Dead hero resurrected by consuming Food stock. - No Science module at game start, but larger reserve of Resources, items, and modules.

To unlock this spaceship, you need to fulfill one of these achievements:
- Reach floor 24 with the Drill. - Never use pause in a winning game (the heroes/system panel does not count as a pause).

#D0B499#Note from sales brochure: ''Kiloliters of bleach and ammonia solve any problem! Caution: Chemical warfare gear required.'' #REVERT#
- Hard mode: Cannot pause game! - Stronger monsters; unfavorable events occur more often. - Resources, heroes, and slots for modules are less common. - Heal a hero is more expensive. - Monsters react when you research new modules.

#F2C01C#Special content available!#REVERT# To unlock this spaceship, you need to fulfill this achievement:
- Research all the modules (level 1) in a winning game.

#D0B499#Note from sales brochure: ''To avoid inciting prisoners, this pod only contains data on meditation, graphic design, and party planning.'' #REVERT#
- Heroes are smarter but less powerful and cannot carry weapons. - Resources, artifacts, and slots for modules are more common. - No Food module at game start, but larger reserve of Resources, items, and modules.

#D0B499#Note from sales brochure: ''This pod is an intellectual living creature, so take care of her, like a member of your crew. Remember, she likes red wine, boiled shrimp with sauce, classical music and pictures of kittens.''#REVERT#
- The powered rooms: *can't be unpowered, *damage modules and artifacts, *produce 0.5 food \7700\ per \7818\, *reduce monsters' Defense \7811\ by 100%. - Monsters are faster. - Modules can't be repaired.

The number of Health Points of your hero.
The ability of your hero to regen Health Points.
The defense capacity of your hero (ability to absorb damage).

Damage Per Second - the average damage inflicted over time by your hero.

Max is eternally optimistic, mostly because he is too terrified of where he is to think about it seriously. He will always be looking to profit from a situation - get extra loot, take one more object, spend less money, etc. - even if it puts him in a bad (risky) position or earns angry comments from his heroes.
Hey, let's get rich! And, uh, not die...
Hi! My friends call me Max. Most others call me things with four letters...
Good to see you, I was getting lonely. No, not scared! Lonely. Ok?

Famous across the galaxy as a bounty hunter, Sara was hired to escort a particularly troublesome prisoner to Auriga. The prisoner in question, an ex-leader of intergalactic pirates, disappeared when the ship went down. Sara remains tight-lipped about it, but is clearly focused on finding the escapee in question and ensuring that justice is served.
Get it straight: I'm not your date or your mom. No kisses, no crying.
Let's move. There's a lot of butts to kick and I only have one lifetime and two feet.
Did you see me? Don't worry. The bad guys won't.

An enormous, powerful man with a violent temper and an angry face, every sentient human that has ever met Gork has been terrified of him. When in a bad mood, he has been known to pull the arms off of animals, people, and construction equipment.
Get me out of here! I promise I kill everybody but you. Probably.
Ho! My name is Gork. You call me "Sir!" And give me food.
You get me out of here, I promise I not kill you. Today.

A simple medical assistant, its occupation is currently listed as "Emergency Paramedic". No current information on its role before the crash is available, and it is unknown if DV8 was prisoner, guard, or crew. And everyone wonders where that nickname came from.
I am called Opbot. You are an interesting morphological specimen.
I am referred to as Opbot. I am an expert in biomechanics. I love to study them.
I am prisoner number, uh, guard with rank , uh... ... ... ... ... I am called Opbot.

An unusually tiny humanoid, Troe's small stature went from a mere annoyance to a cause of insanity. Obsessed with his height, Troe enhanced his bones and muscles to the point where he could carry ridiculously large weapons - and he tends to use them on anyone that makes 'short' jokes.
Hey! You looking down at me? Don't look down at me.
Don't say anything funny about my height, or I'll headbutt your kneecaps.
I eat guys bigger than you for lunch. And have the leftovers cold for breakfast.

Hikensha knows little other than this lab where she grew up. Coming from an avian warrior race whose DNA was altered to maximize their value in arena battles, she imprinted psychologically on images and artifacts of her lost people. Those may only be loot to other adventurers; to Hikensha they are her birthright.
The penalty for desecration is death. Just so we're clear on that.
This place is not much, but it is mine. Be careful what you touch.
Some things here are sacred to my people, and my blade is sharp.

Ratchet is unable to do anything without screaming orders before, during, and after. An overbearing and annoying martinet, she does not consider a job well done until the entire galaxy has heard about it. Unafraid to yell when silence will do, her voice has been classed as a lethal weapon.
HI! WE SHOULD BE QUIET! THERE ARE LOTS OF MONSTERS HERE!
I'M A NURSE! I'M NOT OBSESSIVE-COMPULSIVE, I JUST WANT EVERYTHING CLEAN!
I'M A MEDICAL PROFESSIONAL, NOT A CONTROL FREAK! ...OR IS IT THE OTHER WAY AROUND?

A light, quick, and deadly forager, Skroig has a problem of which it is completely unaware: It should have been born a rakish nobleman in the era of the Musketeers. Unusually dapper and witty for an insectoid carrion eater, always well-dressed and with a delicate palate, Skroig's wit, sophistication, and elegant use of a blade are completely wasted on its peers.
Aggressive: If I had a face like that, I would look for walls to slam it into.
Friendly: Don't worry, your ugliness isn't visible in a poorly lit dungeon.
Practical: Wear a bag, or you'll frighten the enemy away.

Rakya was originally known as "Kneecapper" for her ability to bring a computer system to its knees. However, as cigarettes were illegal on the ship she ended up extending her meager supply by mixing in anything that burned. The result of six months smoking a mixture of tobacco, paper, rat droppings, toothpicks, and coffee grounds gave her a cough that sounds like the Devil calling your name.
Hraaack! No, that wasn't a rock fall. I just had to cough.
You got a smoke? Y'know - cigs, coffee grounds, cloth, dirt, whatever.
Hraaack! One of these days I'm gonna cough up a lung. And some ribs.

An ex-member of the Special Forces, Ken's biggest problem was the fact that he enjoys self-inflicted pain. Always willing to join a knife fight armed with a tennis ball, Ken was the first volunteer for any mission that was hazardous and brutal.
Whatever doesn't kill you, makes you feel good.
That monster just hurt me! It was... nice. Where'd it go? Come back!
Pain is the universe's way of letting you know you're still alive.

One of the few remaining humanoids in the galaxy to wear a tweed jacket and smoke a pipe, Josh is willing to give long (and generally inaccurate) explanations of any object, event, or person. Many suspect that he was imprisoned for boring people to death.
Nice to meet you. Did you know the word "meet" is derived from hunters sharing "meat" during their expeditions?
Lovely cave, eh? Clearly the result of sedimentation induced by ultramafic rhyolites.
Seen those flesh-eating bugs? Doubtless Drosophilae of the phylum Porifera, order Rosidae.

A useful burglar and very light on her feet, Golgy's biggest problem is that she is convinced she is a spider. She tends to move sideways and scuttle next to walls, but as long as you don't mind having a partner who eats insects she's a fine addition to any criminal effort.
You wave a newspaper at me, it's the last thing you'll ever see.
I hunt like a spider, cause I have eight legs. But four are invisible.
Ants, flies, maggots, cockroaches... This place is a five-star buffet!

A rogue and adventurer, Joleri was generally found mounted and with a weapon in her hand. She has traveled far and wide on the continent, enriching herself by finding and selling Endless artifacts. However, she was trapped in the dungeon when running from beasts that ate her steed. Now all she can think of is getting back up to the light - and avenging her lost companion.
I miss my steed. Four-legged friends have never betrayed me.
Do you smell this place? Rich in history, in Dust, in death.
Come! Together we will slake our thirst for adventure... and Dust.

Mormish was a reclusive and largely invisible personage before the crash, but now seems to have come out of his shell. Instead of hiding and giving orders through others, he is loud, present, and pushy; people get the feeling that he is trying to sell them something.
Hey, I'm the Warden! Got that? You better believe it!
Careful, I'm the Warden! The big boss. Numero uno, pal.
Of course this is what the Warden looks like. Right? Cause I'm him.

Elise "Boom-Boom" Ness is a lawperson who walks the ragged edge between justice and vigilantism. Reasoning that the crime of "Breaking and Entering" should be a two-way street, she earned her nickname due to her fondness for storming criminal hideouts with heavy duty weaponry.
Hey, if the bad guys can break and enter, why can't the good guys?
All those whose butts need kicking please line up, facing away from me.
There's nothing more fun than disorganizing crime. Preferably with explosives.

The youngest prodigy from a proud family of galactically famous chefs, Nanor ended up disgraced when he unwittingly purchased "black Andromedan truffles" that turned out to be pellets of Velan rabbit dung. Fighting to rebuild his reputation, he is a ruthless and uncompromising opponent who can turn anyone and anything into lunchmeat.
The first thing a chef learns is proper use of a blade. Alla cucinaaaaa!
Cooking is like love: It is a long, hot, sweaty effort that ends in bliss.
Every one of these monsters is going to get spatchcocked, brined, and barbecued!

While rumor says Mizi is possessed by a demon, the truth is different. In fact, the same physical space is occupied by different entities from two distinct planes of reality. As the planes move closer together or farther apart, one or the other personality becomes dominant. This has made it difficult for her to develop serious long-term relationships. On the plus side, the other entity is an ancient demonic war hero which has helped keep insults to a minimum.
Want to hire me on? NO! DO NOT! Yes, of course you should. I SHALL NOT BE HIRED! Shut-up! ... Uh, sorry. Unwanted passenger.
I'm Mizi, a mage and spellcaster. AND I WILL RUIN ALL THOSE WHO DEFY ME! ... No, ignore that. It's the other guy.
Maybe we should join up. It's hard to explain, but you sort of get a two-for-the-price-of-one deal with me...

Known as "Defender of the Archives", Kreyang kept this title even after an unfortunate event in a cryogenic chamber altered her cell structure. Now forbidden to touch her beloved archives for fear of damaging them, Kreyang is triply ferocious in defending Drakken history and lore.
Try to minimize your uneducated transgressions, offworlder.
Alien interference can engender retribution. Understand?
In your eyes a subterranean penitentiary; in ours, a resplendent edifice.

Born the seventh pup of a seventh pup of a seventh pup, yet unable to count higher than "1, 2, lots", Ayairi's glorious future was unlocked when prions from the labs of Auriga slightly altered her brain structure. Now by far the smartest being on Auriga, she hangs out with the dungeon's merchant, an ex-investment banker, discussing stochastic differential equations and the Black-Scholes model for option pricing.

Not monster, native, prisoner, or crew, this strange apparition seems to belong to the ruins in a way that nothing else does. Any understanding of its powers and its origin are less important, however, than the simple fact that it is intelligent, useful, and does not want to eat you.
It is an interruption to my task, but I see you are in need of aid.
My services are not for sale; I join you in the interest of saving these halls.
I see your team could use a guide - and perhaps a touch of wisdom...

Dell is a misplaced transdimensional copy of a non-existant being from a pseudo-reality. Fortunately, he is also a skilled engineer with at least eleven hard science PhDs so minor questions concerning the nature of reality don't bother him much.
This place is in bad shape. Might even run out of wrenches.
You see monsters; I see problems looking for solutions.
I gotta admit, this place is even weirder than Austin.
Nobody knows where this thing came from, what it thinks, or why it does what it does. Eager researchers who interview Bates tend to either quickly change their area of study -- or go mad themselves.
Hiiih hooo... hiii hooo... hiii hooo...

Misha comes from a very cold gulag in a very cold place; much of his reputation stems from the fact that though he and his sisters escaped, none of the guards did. This experience has not affected the warmth of his personality, though it should be noted that the degree of warmth is directly proportional to the number of dead enemies.
Lots of bullets, lots of sandviches, lots of enemies. Life is good!
I miss little Scout guy. And my mother. But I miss Sasha most of all.
I think I saw Spy. But not sure which one...

Herab did, at some point, receive some form of medical training. The duration, sobriety, and quality of that training -- and whether or not it pertained to human beings -- is highly questionable. Herab's eagerness to demonstrate it, however, is not.
Do you see how they do medicine here? It's beautiful!
Medicine should be applied to a situation like a hammer is applied to an egg.
Archimedes! Stop! The floors are messy enough already.

Sound technician and audio engineer, Wes felt obliged to leave civilian life and join the military when his favorite band broke up. With an excellent knack for communications technology he was promoted into the STEAL teams ("Special TEchnologies And Logistics"), and volunteered to join the Success rescue mission in order to track down a slippery old friend who had left to colonize Auriga with Wes's original copy of the classic "Dust My Room" vinyl by the Trolling Stones.
Any Trolling Stones fans here? I was their sound guy until they went disco...
This place drives me crazy. Even the scary shrieks and groans are out of tune.
Radios? Telephones? If it goes "beep" or "boop", I can make it do be-bop.

An operator from her youth, Zugma first played with trucks rather than dolls and then Ogre-scale weapons platforms rather than tanks. A promising career in military engineering with the STEAL teams ("Special TEchnologies And Logistics") was cut short when the officers' quarters she built under enemy fire turned out to be lacking in toilets (and the local diet was laxative-rich). Accustomed to driving machinery under heavy gunfire, the smell of fresh concrete in the morning always reminded her of victory.
Need help with construction? Destruction? It's all the same to me!
I work best under pressure. And under fire.
Everyone should try operating heavy machinery in a war zone! Really. As soon as your feet can reach the pedals.

A highly decorated and devastatingly effective drill sergeant, Sasha was politely but firmly discharged after an international diplomatic incident (orders yelled during a parade caused an entire grandstand of visiting dignitaries to leap to attention). She turned her skills to training rescue animals, a perfect job for the most dangerous voice in the galaxy. Having lost her dog during the unfortunate crash of the rescue vessel, she is now looking for something else to train...
I lost my dog down here. Have you seen a trail of dead monsters?
Yell if you see my dog, okay? And yell louder if it bites you.
I can train anything I can yell at. Be nice, or you're next.

Like all Rosetta models, QV1819 was designed to be the first point of contact with new species during planetary colonization, learning the culture and language of the indigenous people to avoid any potential conflict with the settlers. Acquiring more personality in her AI than other models, QV1819 began referring to herself solely as Rosetta, and felt that her colonists were bringing 'enlightenment to the savages' -- whether the natives wanted them to or not. Fortunately, she seems to be the only one on board with this idea.
Hieroglyphics? No problem. Cave paintings? Read 'em like a book. But I don't really get this whole "texting" thing.
The value of diplomacy led by an artificial intelligence is complete objectivity. We always know who the vile, hateful scum really are.
Really. You call that a language? Please. No subjunctives or declension. End of story.

Max is involved in the story #F2C01C#Who Talked?#REVERT# with Josh, Mormish and Troe. Max was part of a team of thieves and con-artists. One of their members talked, and they all ended up in prison. Though he teased them endlessly, Max had both affection and respect for the other members - the Runt, Grungy, the Prof, and Funny Face.
It appears that Funny Face, the master of disguise on their team, was the one who talked. He is pretending to be Warden Mormish to escape detection - and death. #888888#(The End)#REVERT#
Max is involved in the story #F2C01C#Thief and Guardian#REVERT# with Hikensha and Kreyang.
Max is perhaps not as good as he thought at detecting fakes... #888888#(The End)#REVERT#
Sara is involved in the story #F2C01C#Clash of Heroes#REVERT# with Gork.

Known as a dangerous and reliable mercenary, Sara is in fact the sole survivor of a murderous pirate raid on her home planet, Kaytuël. Her lifetime nemesis and perpetrator of the raid was the leader of the pirates, who she only knew by his nickname: Butcher.

Having discovered that her lifelong enemy is none other than Gork, she is torn between wanting to exit the dungeon and wanting to spill his blood. But she is very happy that they have finally come face to face... #888888#(The End)#REVERT#
Gork is involved in the story #F2C01C#Clash of Heroes#REVERT# with Sara.
Gork has no secrets. Gork is Gork! #888888#(The End)#REVERT#
Opbot is involved in the story #F2C01C#Whiskey Tango Foxtrot Interrogative#REVERT# with Ken.
Opbot was part of an elite commando team, acting as the medical officer and resident tech droid. Apparently, something went wrong during an operation, and Opbot may bear some of the blame.
Opbot and Ken were both, perhaps, to blame for the failed operation. But what exactly was Opbot doing during his overenthusiastic research? And where is Captain Miles ? #888888#(The End)#REVERT#
Troe is involved in the story #F2C01C#Who Talked?#REVERT# with Max, Mormish and Josh.

Troe was part of a team of thieves and con-artists. One of their members talked, and they all ended up in prison. Troe figures that murder is a good way to get revenge, but he doesn't know who did it.
Whoever is in the Warden's mask, and driving the Warden's chair, reminds Troe and Josh of an old acquaintance... And one that is trying to hide from the others! #888888#(The End)#REVERT#
Troe is involved in the story #F2C01C#Cyrano#REVERT# with Joleri and Skroig.

While Troe led the life of an unbalanced loner, he did have the occasional relationship with people who just like to be around crazy. Sadly he has met his match in Lady Joleri, and will have to look for romantic attachment elsewhere. #888888#(The End)#REVERT#
Hikensha is involved in the story #F2C01C#With Honor!#REVERT# with Mizi.

Part of a small community raised on Auriga as part of an Endless experiment, Hikensha has few allies. Considering honor more important than friendship, she is perhaps not bothered by this. #888888#(The End)#REVERT#
Hikensha is involved in the story #F2C01C#Thief and Guardian#REVERT# with Max and Kreyang.
It cost him a backscratcher, but at least she won't have to kill an ally. #888888#(The End)#REVERT#
Deena is involved in the story #F2C01C#To Heal the Lame#REVERT# with Mormish.

Relentless and loud, Deena has few patients but many victims. While she is competent (medically speaking), her ability to drive the wounded into fits of madness has made her an unpopular nurse. #888888#(The End)#REVERT#
Skroig is involved in the story #F2C01C#Cyrano#REVERT# with Troe and Joleri.

This is what happens when you play with the DNA a bit too much. Hoping for an intelligent yet tractable strain of Necrophage, what the Endless scientists got was wit, wisdom, and an insatiable appetite. #888888#(The End)#REVERT#
Skroig is involved in the story #F2C01C#Bug vs. Bugeater#REVERT# with Golgy.
To victor go the spoils... *Belch*. #888888#(The End)#REVERT#
Rakya is involved in the story #F2C01C#Downfall#REVERT# with Elise.
Rakya retains few secrets now that she has been arrested and publicly tried. She maintains, however, her independence, hacking skills, and chronic lung deterioration. #888888#(The End)#REVERT#
Ken is involved in the story #F2C01C#Whiskey Tango Foxtrot Interrogative#REVERT# with Opbot.
The world might be happier if Ken's secrets stay inside him. The more one discovers, the more one thinks that he might better be left alone; preferably with a sharp object. #888888#(The End)#REVERT#
Ken is involved in the story #F2C01C#Flame Wars#REVERT# with Nanor.
If no pain, no gain, then pain, gain... #888888#(The End)#REVERT#

Josh is involved in the story #F2C01C#Who Talked?#REVERT# with Max, Mormish and Troe. Josh was the leader of a gang of thieves and con artists. One day they were all arrested, and they have yet to figure out who talked. It seems unlikely that it was Max.
Though his mental processes are not as quick as he thinks, Josh has successfully eliminated Max and Golgy as suspects. So who betrayed him - Troe or Funny Face?
After meeting the Warden, Josh thinks that his voice sounds familiar. "Funny Face", the fifth member of the team, was in fact a master of disguise. #888888#(The End)#REVERT#
Golgy is involved in the story #F2C01C#Bug vs. Bugeater#REVERT# with Skroig.
It is true that Golgy is a great connoisseur of six-legged dining. Her arrangement with Skroig, however bizarre, at least shows her ability for self-control. #888888#(The End)#REVERT#
Joleri is involved in the story #F2C01C#Cyrano#REVERT# with Skroig and Troe.

Lady Joleri has nothing to hide, compared to the other heroes in the dungeon. Once she gets back to the surface, however, she will have to deal with the fact that she lost her uncle's favorite horse, refused to marry a dim-witted suitor, and sold off the family silver to pay for her travel expenses. #888888#(The End)#REVERT#
Mormish is involved in the story #F2C01C#Who Talked?#REVERT# with Max, Josh and Troe.
Warden Mormish was not that well known to the prisoners and generally kept to himself due to his medical problems. Nobody is really sure who he is.

Once a master of disguise known as "Funny Face," this is not the real Warden Mormish. Whether the warden died in the crash or was murdered, Funny Face has taken his place in order to hide from his ex-comrades - who he betrayed in order to get a lighter sentence. #888888#(The End)#REVERT#
Mormish is involved in the story #F2C01C#To Heal the Lame#REVERT# with Deena.
A disguise grabbed in the haste of the moment may be more harmful than helpful... #888888#(The End)#REVERT#
Elise is involved in the story #F2C01C#Downfall#REVERT# with Rakya.

Elise was primarily known for her contempt for doorknobs and hinges. Eager and aggressive, it is rumored that her place on the ship was organized by higher level officers tired of paying repair bills. #888888#(The End)#REVERT#
Nanor is involved in the story #F2C01C#Flame Wars#REVERT# with Ken.
Shamed by past failures, Nanor is ready to use foodstuffs in every more aggressive ways, hoping to improve his personal stature. #888888#(The End)#REVERT#
Mizi is involved in the story #F2C01C#With Honor!#REVERT# with Hikensha.

Mizi is out of luck, as a simple fake "seance" with friends turned into a nightmare. It was not a fake plastic ouija board they used, but a temporal gateway into a parallel universe of lost demon souls. Though her grasp on reality goes increasingly frail, she does have some amazing new talents. #888888#(The End)#REVERT#
Kreyang is involved in the story #F2C01C#Thief and Guardian#REVERT# with Max and Hikensha.

Kreyang has one and only one goal: To preserve that which has been left behind by those who harbored - and perhaps created - its race. While it is difficult to pursue this quest with the larcenous criminals from the Success, Kreyang does not bend, and will not capitulate. #888888#(The End)#REVERT#
Dell is involved in the story #F2C01C#Australium!#REVERT# with Pat, Misha, and Kaspar.
Dell is a member of one of two competing teams of mercenaries who have joined together in the hopes of finding lodes of the priceless ore called "Australium". #888888#(The End)#REVERT#
Pat is involved in the story #F2C01C#Australium!#REVERT# with Dell, Misha, and Kaspar.
Mrsh sklvr ndk yrbln szx plt klbn thrsh plt plt grgrrrbb. Ztrllnmnm! #888888#(The End)#REVERT#
Misha is involved in the story #F2C01C#Australium!#REVERT# with Dell, Pat, and Kaspar.
Misha is member of RED Team! Ha! Is off to find Australium and watch lots of robots try to outwit bullets! #888888#(The End)#REVERT#
Kaspar is involved in the story #F2C01C#Australium!#REVERT# with Dell, Pat, and Misha.
Kaspar is a member of BLU Team, who has joined with their arch-enemy RED Team in the hopes of finding "Australium" -- and getting to practice offensive medicine... #888888#(The End)#REVERT#
Some prefer the term "advance to the rear"
Yell enough and you'll get a reaction
When you want to be the center of attention.

When you know how to wound or heal anyone.

Easy for you to hit, hard for them to protect.

After this, you'll never want to eat again.
Adding more than just flavor to a meal.
Mounted or on foot, cavalry is trouble.

A blood-soaked white plume inspires rage and recklessness in enemies.
There are some things you just don't want to share.

You can't hoard money while you're fighting.
A very special recipe with very unpleasant effects.
Turns things into smaller pieces of things.
Hero gains in power, loses in obedience...
A fiery (sulfer-smelling) tempest damages monsters and heroes in the room.
The guy with the furry collar was right.
Improved luck at getting more Dust from monsters with the bad luck to die.
Hero adapts tech from the laboratory technology to repair modules and artifacts.
Never seen a monster outsmart a sandvich...
The tougher the modules, the more problems they solve.
It's so much fun to play together!
When the whole team has to rock and roll.
When you want anything but trouble behind the next door.
Not everybody can turn roadkill into resources.
A non-stop flow of multi-syllabic words confuses even the most enraged enemy

After a lifetime of seeing fakes, you know real ones.
It's probably edible if you hold your nose...
When close combat becomes performance art.
When the field of honor is a dungeon closet.
So many targets, so little time.
When you know how to fix - or break - anything.
When scrounging becomes an art form.
Let's hope the place has good drains.
Cold-hearted, but it gets the job done.
Nothing in the dark is scarier than you are.
If you skewer a boar, you'll eat like royalty.

A high calorie and high density mix of rice and blood.
In the darkness of the dungeon, a little light does wonders.
There's a little bit of juice left in this baby...
A bio-nanite, not compatible with native life forms.
Slow down and try again; it's a small target.
Fake pills + l33t skillz = Health Regen (In Infirmary Pod, the Health Regen is replaced by a Defense \7811\ bonus)
Been there, done that, know the module hacks.
Darkness is a great source of adrenaline.
Even if it has no pockets, she'll find something.
A nice way to say "scared to be alone".
A slow learner, but hates being interrupted.
Guarantees that any monster in the room will go for your throat first.
Makes you appear insignificant, uninteresting, and not particularly tasty.
An unusual diet. Do they sparkle in the sunlight?
You just need to be smarter than the monsters.
With a bit of this and a bit of that thrown in, Food goes further.
Specialized batteries repair and recharge armor in the presence of active Dust. (In Infirmary Pod, the Health Regen is replaced by a bigger Defense \7811\ bonus)
Boosted by the presence of a precious artifact.
Filters out pollen, toxic gas, unicorn farts.
Watch out for Heavy Gun Guy!
Just a few whacks with a wrench and it's as good as new.
Share your happiness with all your friends!
Operating a resource module raised to an art form.
Even the Crystal can't slow this machine.
That little place where cops and customs officers never look.
Your pet is every bit as vicious as you are.
One way to keep your pet healthy.
One way or another, the blessings of culture will be beaten into the locals.
Band-aids and baling wire never go out of style.
A grease monkey, even when there's no grease. Or bananas.
Lucky hero is able to get out of the enemy zone.
Heroes get a power boost when their mates are nearby.
Heroes get a defense boost when grouped with others they trust.

Committed to Getting the Heck Out by the outcome of their story, the hero focuses on the job at hand.
Badly wounded? Seeing a bright light? Go the other way!
Makes you want to sing, dance, or fight together.
Everyone gets confused while trying to look busy.
Encyclopedic knowledge of how to fix, hack, or jumpstart anything.

Covered in dust and Dust, activating it may bring wealth - or death.
There is something within that can only be discovered by activating it. No refunds. Good luck.
Each turn, the stele loses Health Points. When it is destroyed, its effect ends.
Your stock of Food \7700\, and the quantity you will receive when you open the next door. Food \7700\ is used to heal, recruit and level up heroes.
Your stock of Industry \7701\, and the quantity you will receive when you open the next door. Industry \7701\ is used to build major and minor modules.
Your stock of Dust \7702\. Dust \7702\ is used to improve the capacity of your crystal and buy Merchant items.

This is the capacity gauge of your crystal. Each unlocked mark gives you the ability to power one room. To unlock a mark, you need 10 Dust \7702\. To power/unpower a room, you have to use the middle-click \7803\ of your mouse on that room.

Your stock of Science \7703\, and the quantity you will receive when you open the next door. Science \7703\ is used to improve the capacities of your major and minor modules when analyzing an Endless artefact, and to reset skills of your heroes.
It has a barrel, and things come out, but it tends to annoy rather than wound.
Fires debilitating blasts of compressed teen popstar music. Illegal on most planets.
Once a simple submachine gun, this one is covered with remnants of fur and blood.
An excellent tool for collecting involuntary blood donations.

#F2C01C#Unlocks: Duelist#Revert#
Good for putting holes in things. Note: Do not grab end with blade.
Hurts them, helps you. What's not to love?
You do NOT want to meet the beast whose teeth this picked.
Good for those times when drawing blood is just not enough.
In fact this pistol holds eight bullets, but the prisoner who built it from cigar tubes and doorhandles could not count higher than six.
Developed for stapling titanium armor sheets to steel girders, this also does a good job on creatures.
Stolen from the ship's kitchens, this high-pressure dried rice dispenser puts out a hail of grains that removes flesh from bones.
Invented for use in low-security prisons, the gun does merely average damage but looks terrifying.
An exceedingly sharp blade used to repair exceedingly large shoes.
An artifact of the Endless, which damages both by physical force and relentless logic.
Adapted by a prisoner from a mobility aid, the cute nickname hides its brutal efficiency.

#F2C01C#Unlocks: Iron Fist#Revert#
Handcrafted by a deceased prisoner who led the inmates' marching band, it has since been honed into a weapon.
This was crafted by a prisoner faking insanity, who insisted it was used by invisible circus midgets.
This launching device was created by a bored Endless scientist to send physical mail between satellites.
With this enormous crowbar, you don't really need to knock.
It was a simple pool cue, until someone attached the sharpened triangle on it.
Sure, it can open letters. And cans, doors, walls, armor, small space ships...
This pneumatically driven gun leaps into your hand - or through it, if it's in the way.
From the verb "to gattle", meaning "drill full of tiny exploding poisonous holes".
Great for home improvement. And destruction.
Found on the body of a mysterious robed man, this low-calorie weapon is guaranteed to keep your hero fit and trim.
Slightly more protective than naked skin, in a color designed to trigger the gag reflex.
If a guard uniform absorbs this much damage, you wonder what else was on the ship...
Originally conceived as a protective garment for crash test dummies.
Titanium shirts are a fairly common high-quality personal defense system.
This was part of a large, insectoid creature. If you scrape out the remaining bits it should work well.
It makes you wonder what the prisoners had access to, when the guards' armor stops artillery shells.
Designed for ship repairs in deep space. Bonus: If you wet yourself, the suit will handle it.
This complicated jacket, meant to restrain violent individuals, makes good armor (if left unbuckled).
Nobody knows which crew member enjoyed dressing up like a ballerina. But given the amount of steel and wire involved, they must have been huge.
This quantum Tunneled-shirt displays the image of objects behind the wearer, making them difficult to target.

#F2C01C#Unlocks: Neurostun Lite#Revert#
Discovered somewhere in the abandoned halls of the dungeon, this strange artifact generates a defensive field. And smells like butter.
A set of blue exoskeleton armor whose origin and uses are unknown...

#F2C01C#Unlocks: Me first!#Revert#
Double-breasted, pin-striped, and guaranteed to make everyone you meet hate you.
Orange and spring-loaded, it jumps very far and fast.
The previous owner was beheaded by Vikings. Apparently he tried to steal from them. In this situation revenge was indeed sweet.

#F2C01C#Unlocks: Repair#Revert#
Useful for odd jobs in odd places.
Don't laugh. These were made for working with fire, blades, and blunt objects.
Stolen from the prison laundry, it is good for other uses besides ironing.
This bloody victory trophy was torn from a 300-kilo feral rabbit.
Intended as ornaments, these gaudy, kitschy bracers are essentially indestructible.

#F2C01C#Unlocks: Placebo#Revert#
The first of a long line of aid kits, its value is mostly historical as many of the contents have rotted away.
Created as a counter-weapon that frags incoming grenades, it can also counteract some projectiles.
Leftover Endless technology, the Radiating Adaptive Ionizer is good for both skin care and muscle tone.
When injected into scorched earth, this powerful bio-technology converts battlefields into lush plains.

#F2C01C#Unlocks: Operate#Revert#
One of three great artifacts of the Endless scientist known as The Monk, it can only be controlled at the same time as *one* of its two brethren: Budget and Quality.
Most likely jettisoned from a bathroom when the ship crashed, it is good to have a spare magazine around to read when you are bored.
With the look and texture of volcanic stone, this doubles for personal hygiene and self-defense.

#F2C01C#Unlocks: Master Hacker#Revert#
In fact a complete manual of hacking, DIY, and home chemistry, the cover is merely a disguise.
This strange... thing was found in the ruins. Its radiation increases reflexes and coordination at the cost of smelling like rancid pork.
These have no effect if swallowed, but their constant giggling lightens the mood and builds confidence.

#F2C01C#Unlocks: Pilfer#Revert#
This odd headpiece discovered in the dungeon improves normal vision from 3D to 4D, giving brief glimpses into the near future.

#F2C01C#Unlocks: Operate#Revert#
This tiny bar is where microscopic beings drink, tell lies, and start fights. The device taps into their life energy and transmits it to the wearer.

#F2C01C#Unlocks: Me first!#Revert#
Wear this if you want them to hit you first.

#F2C01C#Unlocks: Skulker#Revert#
Actually an aftershave for a reptilian species; for others it is highly caustic.

#F2C01C#Unlocks: Repair#Revert#
Though blunt and unbalanced, it is made of an indestructible material.
These helpful microscopic creatures will repair your body AND be the best wing-men around!

USE ONLY AS DIRECTED BY A MEDICAL DOCTOR OR COMMANDING OFFICER

#F2C01C#Unlocks: Pickpocket#Revert#
There's no better way to collect extra Dust

#F2C01C#Unlocks: Iron Fist#Revert#
Causes monsters to fall down, grab an ankle and cry

#F2C01C#Unlocks: Team Spirit!#Revert#
Ensures you always work better in groups

#F2C01C#Unlocks: Knowledge Is Good#Revert#
A strange, but very useful, black box. No need to panic

#F2C01C#Unlocks: Extenders#Revert#
Practical for those long, dry spells

#F2C01C#Unlocks: Scamper#Revert#
They only see where you were, not where you are
Not considered edible by most sentient beings, this snack requires teeth capable of chewing gravel. On the plus side, it tastes like vodka.

#F2C01C#Unlocks: Gas Mask#Revert#
A highly effective defense against anything from flatulation to the most toxic nerve gas. The only drawback is that the mask's active ingredient causes idyllic, pastoral hallucinations.

#F2C01C#Unlocks: Group Therapy#Revert#
The only flying animal not yet eaten by the dungeon inhabitants, Archimede stays safely in the pocket of whoever is carrying it.

#F2C01C#Unlocks: Gear Check#Revert#
One letter better than its famous predecessor, this handheld marvel contains optimized solutions for the materials, project plans, and techniques of module construction.

#F2C01C#Unlocks: Bloody Showman#Revert#
Tarnish it notte, presumptuous one.
Guaranteed to create laughs at any party when everybody suddenly loses half their normal weight!
These improve self-confidence by recounting to the wearer all the clever things they did that day.
A health aid for the forgetful, this wristband tests vital signs and injects appropriate pharmaceuticals.

#F2C01C#Unlocks: Rabble Rouser#Revert#
This wearable music player's collection of off-color drinking songs is guaranteed to liven up any gathering.

#F2C01C#Unlocks: Psionic Pstrike#Revert#
This item that transfers brainwave energy to its user was just a party trick until people started dying.

#F2C01C#Unlocks: Bricopedia#Revert#
The powerful magics held in this bracelet help to heal and invigorate the wearer.

#F2C01C#Unlocks: The Boss Is In#Revert#
Clean, simple, and bright, these armbands strike fear into those who have uncompleted action items or disorderly desks.

#F2C01C#Unlocks: Prison Grub#Revert#
Made to give an unfair advantage in prison brawls, it has a chance to poison the opponent.

#F2C01C#Unlocks: Steamroller#Revert#
Nothing can slow you down - or speed you up.

#F2C01C#Unlocks: Secret Compartment#Revert#
A smuggler's best friend.
Gun, bandages, wrench - All you need in one simple package.
The secret to making other things do what you tell them to.
This ancient artifact is filled with sand that flows upward. The note reads: "In case of death, break glass and inhale."
While this is a weapon, it does little more damage than no weapon at all.
Calling this garbage a "gun" is like calling a dull spoon a "weapon." Sure, okay, but....
This piece of junk was named "machine" to convince people that it had moving parts.
Large, clumsy, and brightly colored, this bow makes you a target for any sniper.
This imitation of a real ceremonial sword is only useful for scaring children.
This spear is so useless that as soon as you pick it up you're keen to get rid of it.
This basic armor should protect against light breezes and some mosquito bites.
This clever device is so intricate that nobody knows how to use it.
Take a chance! What's the worst that could happen?... oh, right...
It's a market, even if it's small! And smelly, dark, dangerous, violent, ....
It's a very good price! For a dungeon.
Sorry, the prices are non-negotiable. And you lack Food.
Sorry, the prices are non-negotiable. And you lack Industry.
Sorry, the prices are non-negotiable. And you lack Dust.
Sorry, the prices are non-negotiable. And you lack Science.
What, that's all you want? Do come back!
Hello! Buying and selling only. Life here is too short for loans and investments.
Finally, a customer with some money and not so many teeth!
Let's both get rich! Or at least me, anyway.
Let's do business! This is much more fun than investment banking.
The dungeon is dark, but full of diamonds...
At this price it's like getting away with murder!
You don't have enough Food to buy that. Been eating yourself to death?
You don't have enough Industry to buy that. Been working yourself to death?
You lack Dust to buy that. Lighten my load by killing some more monsters...
You don't have enough Science to buy that. Been trying to research immortality?
I won't say goodbye. I prefer "au revoir"...
I'm not cruel, merely terribly, terribly good at my job.
I can make you a killer deal on that one.
Do come back. I get so lonely when business is bad and there's nobody to talk to.
My friends call me "Dood". It's an inside joke.
The only things I have in this world are what I can sell.

Welcome to Dungeon of the Endless
Your ship has crashed deep into an unknown dungeon. You control a team of heroes. You must explore the dungeon to find its exit, by opening doors.
Right-click \7802\ to give an order like "open door" or "move to another room".
Each room can contain items, new heroes, monsters, and other surprises...
Click \7801\ on the arrow to open the hero panel. Your heroes can level up and equip items.
This is your crystal. You must protect it at all costs or you lose the game. When you find the exit, take it with you to power the elevator.
The crystal allows you to power the rooms with middle-click \7803\ to provide energy to constructible modules (bottom menu).

The crystal is fed by Dust \7702\ found in the dungeon and produces 3 resources each time you open a door: Industry \7701\ to build modules, Science \7703\ (work in progress), Food \7700\ to level up, hire and heal heroes.
You can find these instructions in the Esc menu.
You survived the crash! The only system in working condition in your pod is #FFD767#the Crystal#REVERT#, its source of energy. Defend it at all cost! #FFFFFF#Click \7801\ Next to continue#REVERT#.
Staying put will not help; you have to #FFFFFF#right click \7802\ on the door to open it#REVERT#.

#FFFFFF#Left click \7801\ to select a hero#REVERT#. You don't directly control the movement or the fight; the hero knows what to do when they are in a room. #FFFFFF#Right click \7802\ to move a hero#REVERT# in a room.

You have 4 resources to manage: #FF926D#Industry#REVERT# #FFFFFF#\7701\#REVERT# to build modules, #59DEFF#Science#REVERT# #FFFFFF#\7703\#REVERT# to research new modules, #7FC847#Food#REVERT# #FFFFFF#\7700\#REVERT# to hire, improve and heal your heroes, and #FFD767#Dust#REVERT# #FFFFFF#\7702\#REVERT# to power rooms.

Opening a door is like a #FFFFFF#new turn#REVERT#: you get resources depending on your production (the number under the stock values). #FFD767#Dust#REVERT# #FFFFFF#\7702\#REVERT# may be found in room or by killing mobs. You need 10 #FFD767#Dust#REVERT# #FFFFFF#\7702\#REVERT# to power a room (the top bar displays the number of rooms you can power). #FFFFFF#Click with the mouse wheel \7803\ to power a room#REVERT#.

Powered rooms show their content even when there is no hero present, allow you to build modules, and #FFFFFF#prevent creatures from spawning inside#REVERT#. Clicking the same way #FFFFFF#\7803\#REVERT# on the room allows to de-power and get back the 10 units of #FFD767#Dust#REVERT# #FFFFFF#\7702\#REVERT#.

#FFFFFF#Build modules with #FF926D#Industry#REVERT# #FFFFFF#\7701\#REVERT# by using the bottom left menu#REVERT#. They have many uses: Generating resources, attacking hostile creatures, boosting heroes, etc. There are two categories: "Major"modules in first tab to build on big slots, "Minor"in following tabs to build on small slots. #FFFFFF#Try to build one!#REVERT#
Your team can include up to 4 heroes. #FFFFFF#Right click \7802\ on their portrait to open the Hero management panel#REVERT#.

In this panel, view their #FFFFFF#stats, heal / level them up with #7FC847#Food#REVERT# #FFFFFF#\7700\, and equip them#REVERT# with items from your Inventory (shared by all the heroes but lost between floors). Heroes can get passive and active skills when leveling up.

#FFFFFF#Use Space Bar to pause#REVERT#. You can even give orders when the game is stopped. #FFFFFF#Zoom out (scroll down \7803\)#REVERT# to see the tactical map. Find the other shortcuts in the ESC menu.

Your goal: #FFFFFF#Reach the surface#REVERT#! Find the exit of the current floor, then remove the #FFD767#Crystal#REVERT# (right click #FFFFFF#\7802\#REVERT#) and carry it to the exit point to power the elevator. There are still many things to explain, but don't worry... you'll learn them all by dying!

#F2C01C#So, boss. If you're in here and I'm in here, who squealed?#REVERT#
#F2C01C#Haven't seen Bugeater. Maybe they promised her solitaire refinement in a cellar.#REVERT#
#F2C01C#Whatever... But she hated cops like she loved insects. The Nunt?#REVERT#
#F2C01C#Hehe. He hears you say that, you're historical.#REVERT#
#F2C01C#You got caught too, buddy? So who spilled the beans?#REVERT#
#F2C01C#Huh? What? Some beans? I don't care. I wanna find the guy who talked.#REVERT#
#F2C01C#Sure; pal. Couldn't be Josh - he wanted to be the biggest crook ever.#REVERT#
#F2C01C#Dunno. Somebody who's gonna be dead soon. Funny Face?#REVERT#
#F2C01C#Ah! The warden. An incarcerative imperator, dare I say.#REVERT#
#F2C01C#Well, I ... Hold on. What did you say? Could you repeat that?#REVERT#
#F2C01C#Ah, nothing - whoops! Look at the time. Get ready!#REVERT#
#F2C01C#I was your warden. I'm a little hard to forget.#REVERT#
#F2C01C#Warden? Just another link in the chain that they jerk. But...#REVERT#
#F2C01C#Yeah, sure. No hard feelings. See you around. Uh-oh, time to go!#REVERT#
#F2C01C#Wasn't Bugeater, or the Runt, or Grungy, or Max. It was you!#REVERT#
#F2C01C#Me, the warden? Sir, I don't know who-#REVERT#
#F2C01C#You're the Face. I'm familial with you. You betrothed me! Now you dye.#REVERT#
#F2C01C#Uh,... maybe you mean betrayed? No! Ahhhhh!#REVERT#
#F2C01C#Not name. Way of life. Heh heh...#REVERT#
#F2C01C#Cute. Your last name wouldn't be "Koroser", would it?#REVERT#
#F2C01C#Stop talking. Noisy person. Monsters to kill! Let's go!#REVERT#
#F2C01C#I know where I've seen you. You were on Kaytuël, weren't you.#REVERT#
#F2C01C#Kaytuël! Good fun. Lots of yelling. Chainsaws! Mmmmmm.#REVERT#
#F2C01C#Hey whiny person. Why you care about Kaytuël?#REVERT#
#F2C01C#I guess they were unlucky. Heh heh.#REVERT#
#F2C01C#Funny. Maybe you'll be unlucky, too. Very soon.#REVERT#
#F2C01C#Hey! You should be running away screaming if you saw Gork on Kaytuël.#REVERT#
#F2C01C#I do a lot of things. But running away and screaming aren't on the list.#REVERT#
#F2C01C#You're alive until we reach the exit. Not a step further.#REVERT#
#F2C01C#Hah! Gork will have fun on Auriga like he did on Kaytuël!#REVERT#
#F2C01C#I can be a patient person. But you're pushing it!#REVERT#
#F2C01C#If I didn't need you to get out, we could settle this quick.#REVERT#
#F2C01C#Heh. Or slow, like we did on Kaytuël.#REVERT#
#F2C01C#Okay, that was it. YOU DIE NOW!#REVERT#
#F2C01C#Ops! Dude! I didn't see you in the medical bay!#REVERT#
#F2C01C#You know, Cap'n Miles was on the ship.#REVERT#
#F2C01C#Yeah. He sees you were a convict, he'll think it was you who did it on Regulus 4.#REVERT#
#F2C01C#That night on Regulus 4? I was in the med hut. Uh, studying... specimens...#REVERT#
#F2C01C#The Groits stormed the camp. Guard was down. Cap'n Miles got a dishonorable discharge.#REVERT#
#F2C01C#Ah, I didn't hear anything over the noise of my... studying. Wait, you were on guard!#REVERT#
#F2C01C#Yeah, there was a thing, uh I was, uh, tied up, er, indisposed...#REVERT#
#F2C01C#So you weren't just "tied up", you had ropes on. Studying nodeology.#REVERT#
#F2C01C#Yeah, I mean, I was practicing some new knots... but hey, you were killing people!#REVERT#
#F2C01C#The Groits got to my programming! Not my fault. But if Cap'n Miles finds out...#REVERT#
#F2C01C#Ohh yeah. We're both history. Let's hope he stays lost with the ship.#REVERT#
#F2C01C#Dude, I have got to get me some of those cool statues.#REVERT#
#F2C01C#Those "cool statues" are the memories of my people!#REVERT#
#F2C01C#That's okay. We can do a cash deal and I'll give you a cut of the profits.#REVERT#
#F2C01C#Hey! You guys going to sell me some statues?#REVERT#
#F2C01C#Zo! Calm down Hikensha. We will not sell the statues.#REVERT#
#F2C01C#Come on, guys, we're all friends, just talking business. No edged weapons needed...#REVERT#
#F2C01C#If I hear the word "statue", you die.#REVERT#
#F2C01C#(Psst! Hikenchan - your backscratcher. We can sell it.)#REVERT#
#F2C01C#Max O'Kane. We can sell you this ancient tribal symbol for 8 billion quatloos.#REVERT#
#F2C01C#Hmmm... Well it's weird, and smells bad. Might be authentic...#REVERT#
#F2C01C#No! Don't! It is ancient, and, uh, was worn by, I mean, crafted by, uh, our first chieftain!#REVERT#
#F2C01C#Yow! What a babe! Totally hotful hotness. Hey gorgeous! Size don't matter! Wanna do it?#REVERT#
#F2C01C#Are you... is this... WHAT? Is that what passes for courtship here?#REVERT#
#F2C01C#Methinks he has not the soul to woo you with sonnets, tender one.#REVERT#
#F2C01C#Hardly. "Rough hewn", it seems, would be a high compliment.#REVERT#
#F2C01C#I'd say "different walks of life", but I fear that this one mostly crawls...#REVERT#
#F2C01C#Dude, what? You're a bug! How do you talk like that?#REVERT#
#F2C01C#Bug, you gotta teach me to talk like you. All those fancy words? She eats it up!#REVERT#
#F2C01C#I fear that the essence of my soul is poetry. And the essence of my diet, poets.#REVERT#
#F2C01C#What? You are... whatever. Can you teach me to talk fancy?#REVERT#
#F2C01C#Fine. Take one of her attributes you find admirable, and compliment her. Indirectly.#REVERT#
#F2C01C#Hey Joleri! You got some serious booty going. I'm talking "Boom chaka wow-wow", yeah?#REVERT#
#F2C01C#Skroig. I was under the impression he would be improving his discourse.#REVERT#
#F2C01C#I fear the message was mislaid in that great empty cave between the ears and the mouth.#REVERT#
#F2C01C#Any time, babe. You just shake that thing, and I'll be all "Hell, yeah!"#REVERT#
#F2C01C#By the Queen's eggs, recall your lessons this time! Cadence, style, wit...#REVERT#
#F2C01C#Joleri my girl I'm talking to you, 'bout some of the good things we can do -#REVERT#
#F2C01C#Life is harsh, and so is fate, so let's get down and procreate!#REVERT#
#F2C01C#How... virile! Your verse has a certain reckless charm; you may ask my father for my hand.#REVERT#
#F2C01C#This whole "ask my father" thing... We get to sample the goods first?#REVERT#
#F2C01C#What?! Tulak women go to their nuptials as virgins!#REVERT#
#F2C01C#WHAT?! You gotta be kidding... that's... I am *so* outta here. Man, if I had known...#REVERT#
#F2C01C#Well played, my lady. I see your fencing skills are not limited to swordplay.#REVERT#
#F2C01C#Mmmmm... You're a big one. Look tasty...#REVERT#
#F2C01C#Might I return the compliment? You look delectable, my dear.#REVERT#
#F2C01C#'Tis a matter of perspective, no? Who eats whom?#REVERT#
#F2C01C#Yet all's fair in love and war, as they say. And we love you as the spoils of war.#REVERT#
#F2C01C#Never heard that one. You almost make it sound nice...#REVERT#
#F2C01C#Though I gotta say, those limbs you got look nice 'n crunchy.#REVERT#
#F2C01C#You may find the steel that bars your way somewhat less palatable.#REVERT#
#F2C01C#Yeah, I'm no idiot. But I can truss and trim you before you could say "Egad!"#REVERT#
#F2C01C#Ha ha ha! I almost regret how much I'll enjoy broiling you slowly with carrots.#REVERT#
#F2C01C#Okay; Skroig, here's the deal. We both wanna get outta here, yeah.#REVERT#
#F2C01C#And the sooner we do it, the sooner we find out who's the meal, and who's the chef.#REVERT#
#F2C01C#Excellent. Let us depart this oubliette with alacrity, then see who's for dinner!#REVERT#
#F2C01C#HI! I'M THE LEAD MEDICAL PRACTITIONER! THAT'S STILL ALIVE...#REVERT#
#F2C01C#Ah, yes, hello, I was the, eh, the Warden of the ship. The director of the prison.#REVERT#
#F2C01C#YOU'RE THE WARDEN? YOU KEPT ALL THESE GUYS IN CELLS AND PUNISHED THEM?#REVERT#
#F2C01C#Would you be quiet!? Or just give me a painless overdose.#REVERT#
#F2C01C#IT'S OUR SECRET THAT YOU'RE THE WARDEN. HEY, THE BREATHER MASK ISN'T SET RIGHT!#REVERT#
#F2C01C#What? Of course it is. I'd be dead otherwise now go away everything is fine thanks bye.#REVERT#
#F2C01C#IT'LL KILL YOU LIKE THAT. LET ME INCREASE THE OXYGEN... HEY! YOUR LEGS LOOK OKAY!#REVERT#
#F2C01C#Just leave me alone. With my infirmities. I prefer them to your bedside manner.#REVERT#
#F2C01C#What do you mean I don't look sick? Look at my files. Don't touch me! Get away!#REVERT#
#F2C01C#OUR DRUGS COULD HEAL YOU IN SECONDS. DON'T YOU WANT TO LOSE THAT MASK?#REVERT#
#F2C01C#I like the mask. I'm used to it. It would cause terrible stress if I took it off.#REVERT#
#F2C01C#DON'T WORRY. WE HAVE DRUGS FOR THAT, TOO!#REVERT#
#F2C01C#No! I'm fine like this. I'm happy. I'm feeling better! It's all good!#REVERT#
#F2C01C#NOT GOOD ENOUGH! TRY SOME OF THIS AND SEE HOW YOU-#REVERT#

#F2C01C#I was the chef. I did what I could. It's not like I had gourmet ingredients delivered fresh daily.#REVERT#
#F2C01C#You useless noodlemaker. You call that stuff food? What you made us eat?#REVERT#
#F2C01C#You had perfect nutritional balance AND artistic presentation. Even if it was only gruel.#REVERT#
#F2C01C#I'm not letting you off the hook so easy, jabroni. You had no spices! No flavor!#REVERT#
#F2C01C#You know nothing. I had salt, pepper, cunim, maice, nouyoura, sypracee, ... #REVERT#
#F2C01C#Bland bland bland! I'm talking capsicum, you crab. REAL flavor. Flavor that hurts...#REVERT#

#F2C01C#Some noisy- I AM ZORNYU HATBORZ, DEMON LORD OF A THOUSAND ARMIES!#REVERT#

#F2C01C#I know that suit. (Gaaack...) You got the credit for bracing me.#REVERT#
